skill.name: planning
skill.description: Transform ideas into actionable implementation plans. Combines Socratic questioning for requirements discovery with detailed task breakdown for zero-context engineers. Use before any feature development.
skill.summary: Transform ideas into actionable implementation plans. Combines Socratic questioning for requirements...
skill.author: Doyajin174

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown documentation and planning templates. No executable code exists. All static findings are false positives: git commit message templates (feat: description) were misidentified as cryptographic algorithms; markdown code blocks were misidentified as shell execution; a GitHub source URL was misidentified as hardcoded network endpoint. Pure documentation skill with zero attack surface.

content.value_statement: Starting development without a clear plan leads to scope creep and missed requirements. This skill guides you through structured discovery and breaks work into 2-5 minute tasks that any engineer can execute immediately.
actual_capabilities: Guide Socratic questioning for requirements discovery
Generate structured implementation plans with markdown templates
Break features into bite-sized 2-5 minute tasks
Create test-first task specifications with commit messages
Document technical decisions and open questions
Produce ready-to-execute task lists for zero-context engineers
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files directly
Does not integrate with project management tools
Does not estimate timeline or resource requirements
Does not validate technical feasibility automatically

use_cases.title: Feature planning sessions
use_cases.description: Use before starting any feature to clarify requirements and create an executable task list.

use_cases.title: Architecture decision records
use_cases.description: Document technical choices and their trade-offs during the discovery phase.

use_cases.title: Onboarding task breakdown
use_cases.description: Break down complex features into small tasks that new contributors can pick up easily.

prompt_templates.title: Start planning
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to build [feature name]. Help me plan it using the planning skill.

prompt_templates.title: Requirements discovery
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the core problem this feature solves? What constraints must we respect?

prompt_templates.title: Task breakdown
prompt_templates.prompt: Break down the [feature name] into 2-5 minute tasks. Include file paths and test code for each.

prompt_templates.title: Plan review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my plan for [feature name]. Are there any missing files or edge cases?

output_examples.input: I want to build a user notification system for my web app
output: Discovery Summary with core requirements and constraints
Bite-sized tasks with test code and commit messages

output_examples.input: Plan a REST API for a todo list feature
output: Goal statement and tech stack identification
Task list organized by dependency order

output_examples.input: Break down a complex refactoring task
output: Discovery phase with current state analysis
Verification steps for each refactoring phase

best_practices: Run discovery phase before writing any code to avoid rework
Keep each task under 5 minutes to enable parallel work
Include test code in every task for TDD workflow
anti_patterns: Skipping discovery and starting with implementation
Leaving open questions unresolved before execution

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It uses standard MCP tools for file operations.

faq.question: What is the maximum plan size?
faq.answer: Plans can be any length but should break work into small 2-5 minute tasks for parallel execution.

faq.question: How does it integrate with my codebase?
faq.answer: The skill generates markdown plans with file paths. You then execute tasks using Claude or your IDE.

faq.question: Is my project data safe?
faq.answer: This skill only generates templates. It does not read or store any project data externally.

faq.question: Why are my tasks too large?
faq.answer: Split tasks until each takes 2-5 minutes. Include test code and commit message in every task.

faq.question: How is this different from a PRD?
faq.answer: Plans focus on executable tasks with file paths and test code. PRDs describe what to build; plans describe how to build it.
